content: for personal use only questions support@westknits com 2 photography by westknits version 2 abbreviations bobble bind off co cast on k knit k2tog knit 2 sts together sl slip_stitch purl-wise unless instructed otherwise tbl through back loop wyif with yarn in front instructions watch this westknits video to assist with the long tail bobble all sts on the next rs row using an i-cord bobble cast on method https //youtu be/mwle60tek5q i-cord bobble *k2 k2tog tbl sl3 sts onto left needle repeat from * until 6 total sts remain using 2 strands of yarn held together co 126 sts using a long tail cast on break yarn leaving an 8″ / 20cm tail place the first 3 sts onto your right needle and the last 3 sts onto your left k123 sl3 wyif needle with the purl bumps facing each other and both needles pointing to the right graft the remaining 6 sts together using kitchener stitch repeat last row 282 more times or until there are 142 garter ridges work more repeat from a longer blanket or work fewer repeats for a shorter blanket watch this westknits video to assist with the i-cord grafting https //youtu be/7yn6-ih2p_m finishing watch this westknits video to assist with the i-cord bind off break yarn and weave in ends i didn t block my blanket but you could soak it or give steam it to relax and smooth https //www youtube com/watch v=uugac-6rety&t=61s the fabric if you still have leftover yarn attach some fringe to the co and bobble edges © 2012 stephen west all rights reserved pattern for personal use only questions support@westknits com 3 photography by westknits version 2
